_updateImplementationStored().details: It uses the LogicVersionsRegistry contract to get the logic address or the cached address if valid.It caches the current logic address for the proxy to reduce gas on subsequent calls within the same block.

returns._0: Escrow total value denoted in the lending token.

params.dappData: the current dapp data to be executed.

claimTokens().details: The loan must not be active.The recipient must be the loan borrower AND the loan must be already liquidated.

claimTokensByCollateralValue(address,uin.details: The loan must not be activeThe loan must be liquidatedThe recipeient must be the loan manager

params.recipient: address to send the tokens to
params.value: The value of escrow held tokens, to be claimed based on collateral value

returns._0: The list of all tokens held by this contract.

params.aLoanID: the loan ID associated to this escrow instance.
params.lendingTokenAddress: The token that the Escrow loan will be for.
params.settingsAddress: The address of the settings contract.

repay(uint256).details: If the Escrow's balance of the borrowed token is less than the amount to repay, transfer tokens from the sender's wallet.Only the owner of the Escrow can call this. If someone else wants to make a payment, they should call the loan manager directly.

TokenAdded(address,uint256).notice: This event is emitted when a new token is added to this Escrow.

TokenRemoved(address,uint256).notice: This event is emitted when a new token is removed from this Escrow.

TokensClaimed(address).notice: Notifies when the Escrow's tokens have been claimed.

_updateImplementationStored().notice: Updates the current implementation logic address for the stored logic name.

borrower().notice: Holds the borrower's address that owns this Escrow loan.

calculateTotalValue().notice: Calculate the value of the loan by getting the value of all tokens the Escrow owns.

callDapp((address,bytes)).notice: It calls a given dapp using a delegatecall function by a borrower owned the current loan id associated to this escrow contract.

claimTokens().notice: Sends the tokens owned by this escrow to the owner.

claimTokensByCollateralValue(address,uin.notice: Send the equivilant of tokens owned by this escrow (in collateral value) to the recipient,

getTokens().notice: Returns an array of token addresses, for which this Escrow contract has a balance.

implementationStored().notice: It stores the last known logic address locally to reduce gas costs.

initialize(address,address,uint256,addre.notice: It initializes this escrow instance for a given loan manager address and loan id.

lendingPool().notice: Holds the address of the LendingPool used for this Escrow loan.

lendingToken().notice: Holds the token that this Escrow loan was taken out with.

loanID().notice: Holds the loan ID of the loan for this Escrow in the LoansManager contract.

loanManager().notice: Holds the instance of the associated LoanManager contract for this Escrow loan.

logicName().notice: It represent the logic name (key) used for this proxy.

logicRegistry().notice: It returns the logic registry that is used to determine the implementation logic for this proxy.

settings().notice: It holds the platform Settings instance.

strictDynamic().notice: Boolean indicating if the proxy must check the registry for a new implementation.

upgradeProxyTo(address).notice: It updates a proxy's cached implementation address.It must only be called by the LogicVersionsRegistry for non strict DynamicProxy

userdoc.notice: This contract is used by borrowers to call Dapp functions (using delegate calls).This contract should only be constructed using it's upgradeable Proxy contract.In order to call a Dapp function, the Dapp must be added in the DappRegistry instance.
